value.subject: HW4 NoSQL Visualization
value.content: In HW4 NoSQL part, we need to plot the 13 locations in both Q2 and Q6. I have no idea if we need to plot these locations in Q6 using Geo Scatter, what kind of chart can we use for Q2 plotting?

follow_ups.subject: I have the same confusion. I have been using Geo Scatter for all the questions from Q2 to Q5. Are we supposed to use some charts other than Geo Scatter for Q2 to Q5?

value.subject: HW4, Q3
value.content: I couldn’t find the shell dataset that has num_rings as an attribute. I managed to find the same dataset only with a different attribute name (instead of num_rings it will be class_ring). Can anyone give me the link for a dataset that has num_ring attribute, just to be safe.

value.subject: HW4 - Data Mining
value.content: For Homework 4 (Data Mining) Do we need to include the Flow Design screenshots for KNIME and RapidMiner along with the output screenshots?

value.subject: Can we do both Data Mining AND NoSQL?
value.content: Two’s better than one! For Homework 4, can we submit both the Data Mining AND the NoSQL assignments?

value.subject: HW4 Q5 NoSql section
value.content: Hi I was wondering if we need to draw the triangle line in Q5, geospatial scatter doesn’t seem to support it. Thanks a lot!

follow_ups.subject: I don't know how to draw the triangle and bounding box either. Can I just show the query and the result?
No need to draw the triangle.

value.subject: Solution to RapidMiner's empty 'select attributes' list

follow_ups.subject: Thank you for this! I ended up doing both of the top 2 things suggested.
follow_ups.content: 1. I enabled 'Synchronize Meta Data with Read data' option in the 'Process' menu. But I still wasn't seeing my attributes, so I also did #2. 2. I typed in 'length' on the right side and hit the green + to manually add in the length. Same for the other attributes that I wanted. Then after running once, when I went back to the attribute selector I could see all the attributes.

follow_ups.subject: It works for me. Thank you. It seems that this bug has been there for 10 years. I saw a post with the same issue in 2013.

value.subject: HW4 Q5
value.content: NoSQL Section. In Q5, when I apply the query to select national parks within a Triangle, the chart just goes blank. No error or warnings whatsoever. The query is syntactically correct. Anyone facing the same issue?

follow_ups.subject: Try changing your indices on the geoscatter in case you flipped the long and lat

value.subject: Bounding Box
value.content: I choose the NoSQL version for HW4. It requires us to insert rows in a specific style (not geospatial data style). However, in step 3, it asks us to specify a bounding box. I have no hint on this step... Could someone please give me some hints about query? Thanks a lot!

follow_ups.subject: Same question here. I can do it with hardcode, but in addition to the hardcoded method, do we have any other better method to solve it?

value.subject: [NoSQL] Question 6 Additional Key
value.content: Just to be sure, adding an additional key to color locations according to type for question/part 6 is optional, right?I have it set to color code by name and not category if that is ok and should not impact anything
